name: I Was Young When I Started This Quiz...  | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Finland.

	Nokia's history dates back to 1865, when a Finnish mining engineer started a wood-puplping mill in southern Finland. In the 1990s they streamlined into a telecommunications company.

questions.text: The late 'Saturday Night Live' comedian, Phil Hartman, held what profession, before appearing on the hit comedy show ?
questions.correct: An illustrator of rock album covers
questions.explanation:
An illustrator of rock album covers.

	Among the many groups he designed album covers for, were Crosby, Stills and Nash.

questions.text: What two things were historically out of place in the movie 'Spartacus' ?
options: A telephone and a can of Coke
A bottle of Chianti and a disposable razor
A radio and a candy bar
questions.explanation:
Wristwatches and tennis shoes.

	The 1960 film, 'Spartacus', featured soldiers wearing both these items.

questions.text: What was the inspiration for Sir Paul McCartney's song 'Calico Skies' ?
questions.explanation:
The Hamptons (Long Island).

	Sir Paul was holed-up during a particularly bad storm. The song is from the album 'Flaming Pie'.

questions.text: What do Cheryl Ladd, Crazy Horse, Tom Brokaw and George McGovern have in common ?
options: All were born on a Sunday
questions.explanation:
All are famous South Dakotans.

	South Dakota, nicknamed the Coyote and also the Mount Rushmore State.

options: A huge boulder near Mount Killimanjaro
questions.explanation:
Ayers Rock.

	Ayers Rock, has been renamed the Uluru Monolith. It is the largest monolith in the world.

questions.text: What band had the first video to be broadcast on MTV ?
questions.explanation:
The Buggles.

	The premiere broadcast aired on August 1, 1981. The song was 'Video Killed the Radio Star'.

questions.text: What country is the cult movie series 'Lemon Popsicle' from ?
questions.explanation:
Israel.

	The series featured the corny adventures of three teenage guys who experience the trials and tribulations of adolescence.

questions.text: What actor had a pet pig named Violet ?
questions.explanation:
Boris Karloff.

	Born in London, England in 1887, Karloff is best known for his portrayal of 'Frankenstein'.

questions.text: What did Felix Wankel give the world ?
questions.explanation:
The Wankel rotary engine.

	Felix Wankel, a German engineer who invented his engine in the 1950s. The Wankel engine is a gasoline engine with rotors instead of pistons.
